newsitem.title: USA: Calif. home sales surge 6.4 pct in quarter.
newsitem.headline: Calif. home sales surge 6.4 pct in quarter.

text.p: California home sales surged 6.4 percent in the first quarter of 1997 to their highest level since 1989, according to the California Association of Realtors.

A total of 531,160 existing, single-family detached homes closed escrow during the first quarter on a seasonally-adjusted annualized basis, the highest sales level since 601,730 homes were sold in the first quarter of 1989, the group said.

The brisk sales activity represents a 6.4 percent increase from the 499,340 sales in the first quarter a year ago. Sales were 7.3 percent ahead of the final quarter of 1996 when a total of 495,100 were sold on an annualized basis, it said.

"The rebound in the California housing market we first witnessed in 1995 has now reached significant proportions and reflects a rejuvenated economy statewide," Bob Kulick, the association's president, said in a statement.

The statewide median sales price of an existing, single-family home was $174,600 in the first quarter, up 0.5 percent from $173,810 in the fourth quarter of 1996 and virtually unchanged from the $174,770 median home price of one year ago, the report said.
The California Association of Realtors, headquartered in Los Angeles, is one of the largest state trade associations in the United States.
